overview.title: API Overview
overview.description: Access data about the Horizon universe through RESTful endpoints. Includes data from Horizon Zero Dawn, Horizon Forbidden West, The Frozen Wilds, and Burning Shores.

endpoints.subtitle-endpoint: Access all characters from the Horizon universe.
endpoints.description-endpoint: Get detailed information about each character, including their story, affiliations, and appearances in the games.
Explore each type of machine with data on its class, size, origin, and combat behavior.

endpoints.subtitle-endpoint: Discover regions of the Horizon world.
endpoints.description-endpoint: Check the location, environment, and areas belonging to each region.
Get information about some areas and their relationship with regions or factions.
Discover the cauldrons, their location, difficulty, and the machines that can be overridden.
Translate API responses into multiple languages with built-in artificial intelligence.

apidocs.title: API Documentation
apidocs.description: Comprehensive reference guide for the Horizon API. Access characters, machines, regions, areas, cauldrons, and AI-powered automatic translations.

tabHome.quickstart-description: You can get started using the API in minutes. No authentication of any kind is required.
tabHome.endpoint-1-description: The root endpoint provides an overview of all available endpoints in the API.

tabCharacters.title: Characters
tabCharacters.description: Access detailed information about all characters in the Horizon universe, including their stories, affiliations, and game appearances.
tabCharacters.main-endpoint-description: Returns the complete list of characters registered in the API. Accepts 3 optional parameters (page, size, and search).
tabCharacters.parameter-size: Number of records per page. Default value: 25. The page size can be customized. Minimum value: 25 and maximum value: 50.
tabCharacters.parameter-search: Filters characters whose names contain the specified text in a case-insensitive partial search.
tabCharacters.issue-request: All three parameters are optional and can be combined freely. Including just one activates pagination. If none are specified, the complete list of characters is returned.
tabCharacters.parameter-note: Note: if the search parameter is used and the number of results is less than 25, the paginated response will return null values in the previousPage and nextPage fields, indicating that there are no more pages available to navigate.
tabCharacters.individual-request-description: Get the full details of a specific character using their ID.
tabCharacters.pagination-request-description: Example of using the page, size, and search parameters together to filter results.

tabMachines.title: Machines
tabMachines.description: Query machines from the Horizon universe: name, class, size, origin, and in which games they appear.
tabMachines.main-endpoint-description: Returns the complete list of machines available in the API. Accepts 3 optional parameters: page, size, and search.
tabMachines.parameter-size: Number of records per page. Default value: 25. The page size can be customized. Minimum value: 25 and maximum value: 50.
tabMachines.parameter-search: Filters characters whose names contain the specified text in a case-insensitive partial search.
tabMachines.issue-request: All three parameters are optional and can be combined freely. Including just one activates pagination. If none are specified, the complete list of characters is returned.
tabMachines.parameter-note: Note: if the search parameter is used and the number of results is less than 25, the paginated response will return null values in the previousPage and nextPage fields, indicating that there are no more pages available to navigate.
tabMachines.individual-request-description: Get the full details of a specific machine using its ID.
tabMachines.pagination-request-description: Example of using the page, size, and search parameters together to filter results.

tabRegions.title: Regions
tabRegions.description: Discover the regions of the Horizon universe: areas where the main events take place, with their setting, biomes, and associated areas.
tabRegions.main-endpoint-description: Returns the complete list of regions registered in the API. This endpoint does not have pagination.
tabRegions.individual-request-description: Allows you to obtain the data of a specific region by its ID.
tabRegions.search-request-description: Allows you to search for regions using the search parameter, which filters by partial matches in the name (case-insensitive).

tabAreas.title: Areas
tabAreas.description: Explore areas present in the Horizon universe: regions, geographic zones, and locations related to factions, characters, or machines.
tabAreas.main-endpoint-description: Returns the complete list of areas registered in the API. This endpoint does not have pagination.
tabAreas.individual-request-description: Allows you to obtain the complete information of a specific area by its ID.
tabAreas.search-request-description: Allows you to search for areas using the search parameter, which filters by partial matches in the name (case-insensitive).

tabCauldrons.title: Cauldrons
tabCauldrons.description: Discover the cauldrons of the Horizon world: ancient underground facilities where machines were manufactured. Each cauldron presents different levels of difficulty and types of machines that can be overridden.
tabCauldrons.main-endpoint-description: Returns the complete list of cauldrons registered in the API. This endpoint does not have pagination.
tabCauldrons.individual-request-description: Allows you to obtain detailed information about a specific cauldron using its ID.
tabCauldrons.search-request-description: Allows you to search for cauldrons using the search parameter, which filters by partial matches in the name (case-insensitive).

tabTranslation.title: AI Translation
tabTranslation.description: The data was retrieved and stored from the Horizon Wiki site in its original language, so all responses are generated in English. The automatic translation module was implemented to facilitate responses in other languages natively, however it is currently in the development and testing phase. This option allows you to translate any endpoint of the Horizon API using GPT-5.
tabTranslation.experimental-note: If the response takes longer than 30 seconds, the request is automatically canceled to prevent server blocks.
tabTranslation.parameter-lang-description: To obtain translated results, add the ?lang= parameter at the end of any endpoint, indicating the desired language (e.g., es, ru, jp, fr, etc.).
tabTranslation.general-example-description: General example: /api/areas?lang=es will return information translated into Spanish. This parameter applies to all available endpoints.
tabTranslation.example-2-description: Below are examples of translated responses generated by the GPT-5 model.
tabTranslation.warning-note: ⚠️ This translation option is still under development. Results may vary depending on the complexity of the request and the requested language.
